  {panel}

*Feature Summary*

As a multinational company and having customers around the world, it would be nice if JIRA has a language change(translation) so different users can select languages that work best for them.

*How Feature Works*
* Add in flags or a drop down that contains languages available to JIRA.
* User presses the drop down and selects the language he or she wants JIRA to appear in.

*Available Feature*
JIRA language displayed to a user is dependent on the language user set in their profile page.
Hence the user would need to access the profile and change JIRA to his preferred language for the change to take effect.
fields.summary: Allow changing of JIRA language from the current page user is

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61036].
  {panel}

Create a permission API endpoint for dashboards like filters.

This is dependent on having a model where a user other than the owner can edit the dashboard.

This can be a security concern that an administrator can't autocorrect a dashboard when it accidentally gets shared with the Global share permission (Everyone). 

The corrective action through the API I would envision is:
GET /rest/api/2/dashboard/:id/permission
DELETE /rest/api/2/dashboard/:id/permission/:permission_id where type==Global
POST /rest/api/2/dashboard/:id/permission
{ "type": "group", "groupname": "administrators" }

Right now to get a list of these publicly shared dashboard we can run a curl on  https://site.atlassian.net/secure/ConfigurePortalPages!default.jspa?view=popular.  While this doesn't necessarily contain sensitive information, it may include names that could indicate a non-public project codename.
fields.summary: Jira Dashboard Permissions API

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61020].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
{{<first-use-flow>}} defines a condition, but it's not observed when evaluating which first use flow needs to run.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Add a condition to the {{<first-use-flow>}} module descriptor. Make sure it evaluates to false
* Create a new user for which the {{<first-use-flow>}} condition will apply
* Login with the newly created user

h3. Expected Results
The first use flow should not be selected, since there's a condition that evaluates to false.

h3. Actual Results
The condition is not observed and the first use flow is selected anyway.

h3. Notes
The associated module descriptor, {{FirstUseFlowModuleDescriptor}}, contains a condition which is parsed from the associated XML. The code where the {{FirstUseFlowModuleDescriptor}} is used, however, never actually checks the condition when evaluating which onboarding flow has to be displayed after the user logs in for the first time.

In a nutshell, {{OnboardingServiceImpl}} needs to check the condition associated with the {{<first-use-flow>}}. This needs to happen both when the first use flow is displayed for the first time ({{OnboardingServiceImpl#startHighestWeightFlow()}}, and when the user resumes a first use flow that was previously interrupted ({{OnboardingServiceImpl#getFirstUseFlowModuleDescriptorByKey()}}).
fields.summary: FirstUseFlowModuleDescriptor condition not working

In the backlog view, we create Versions; but elsewhere (Portfolio, and in the Jira Releases sidebar) these Versions are termed Releases. Same thing, different locations, different names. This confuses the heck out of my teams and complicates on-boarding/training.

Regardless of the name, these "things" cannot be searched on either. Why can't I filter on releases? "Show me all unreleased releases" seems like a helpful option.

In Portfolio, I could have that filter and point Portfolio at it and see all releases on one timeline *boom*. Instead I'm clicking and adding 20+ projects.

Isn't a release/version just a great big Epic? Treat them the same. Release > Epic > Story > Task > Sub.

h3. Problem Definition
As a JIRA Admin, I would like to check if a user has the Browse Project permission of a particular project which: 
* I do not have the Browse Project permission hence I am unable to input the issue(s) into the Permission Helper
* I have the Administer Project permission for. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the JIRA Admin to check for Browse projects permission for users without inputting the issue if the Admin has the administer project permission.
 
h3. Workaround 
Either the permission of "Browse projects" is granted to the JIRA admin or ensure that a user that has both the "Administer Project" and "Browse Projects" permission for that project uses the permission helper on behalf of the JIRA admin.
fields.summary: Checking for User's Browse Projects permission in permission helper without inputting issue.

fields.description:
h3. Summary Creating an XML Backup using Oracle JDBC driver 12.1.0.2 doesn't properly export the Active Objects tables sequence definitions. h3. Environment * JIRA Core / Software 7.0.x or JIRA Core / Software 7.1.x * Oracle Database 12c Enterprise Edition Release 12.1.0.2.0 - 64bit Production h3. Steps to Reproduce # Connect JIRA to Oracle as per [Connecting JIRA applications to Oracle|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+Oracle]. # As recommended in our [Supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Supported+platforms] document, download the Oracle JDBC driver 12.1.0.2 from [Oracle's website|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/features/jdbc/index-091264.html] and replace the existing ojdbc7 driver from the {{$JIRA_INSTALL/lib}} folder with the 12.1.0.2. # Create a project in JIRA and generate an XML Backup via {{/secure/admin/XmlBackup!default.jspa}}. h3. Expected Results Sequence definitions for Active Object tables are exported. This can be inspected by extracting the XML Backup and browsing the {{activeobjects.xml}} file. Using the table {{AO_B9A0F0_APPLIED_TEMPLATE}} as an example, we would expect the {{autoIncrement}} attribute for the *ID column* definition (the primary key) set to *true*, as following: {code:xml}
{code} h3. Actual Results The primary keys for the tables in the {{activeobjects.xml}} file have their {{autoIncrement}} attribute set to false. Using the previous example ({{AO_B9A0F0_APPLIED_TEMPLATE.ID}}) {code:xml}
{code} *Business Impact* Importing this XML Backup into a new JIRA instance will corrupt the data and break several JIRA functionalities. For instance, creating a new project after importing a corrupted XML Backup will fail with the following exception: {noformat}2016-01-20 13:26:02,663 http-nio-8080-exec-3 ERROR admin 806x17642x1 6f8mxx 10.1.3.200,10.12.32.85 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [c.a.jira.project.ProjectCreateRegistrarImpl] The handler with id com.atlassian.jira.project-templates-plugin:apply-project-template-handler threw an exception while handling a notification about a project being created com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library: Database: - name:Oracle - version:Oracle Database 12c Enterprise Edition Release 12.1.0.2.0 - 64bit Production With the Partitioning, Real Application Clusters and Automatic Storage Management options - minor version:1 - major version:12 Driver: - name:Oracle JDBC driver - version:11.2.0.2.0 java.sql.SQLIntegrityConstraintViolationException: ORA-01400: cannot insert NULL into ("JIRA716"."AO_B9A0F0_APPLIED_TEMPLATE"."ID") {noformat} h3. Notes * This was reproducible on JIRA 7.0.10 and 7.1.6. * The existing implementation invokes {{DatabaseMetaData#getTables}} to retrieve the sequences in oracle with the types parameter being set as "_SEQUENCE_". However, due to a security patch - CVE-2016-3506, the "_SEQUENCE_" is not treated as legal input anymore. h3. Workaround * For regular backups, we recommend using the native database tools, as highlighted in our [Backing up Data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/jira/Backing+up+data] document. * If an XML backup is required (e.g. to migrate to another database), use a different Oracle jdbc driver version temporarily (e.g. 12.1.0.1): ** [Which version of JDBC drivers support which version of Oracle database?|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/enterprise-edition/jdbc-faq-090281.html#01_02]
fields.summary: AO sequences are missing in XML backups created using the Oracle JDBC driver 12.1.0.2

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an LDAP user is added as a watcher , then removed directly from LDAP, this user is not removed as a watcher. 

h3. Environment
* Tested on JIRA 7.1.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an LDAP User and Sync to JIRA
# Add that LDAP User as a watcher to one of the issues
# Delete the User from LDAP and Sync
# User is removed from JIRA

h3. Expected Results
# User should be removed as the watcher of the issue

h3. Actual Results
# User is not removed as watcher of the issue.
# Checking the {{userassociation}} table, the entry for the deleted user still exist

h3.Workaround
* [There is no ID mapped for the user key|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/There+is+no+ID+mapped+for+the+user+key]
fields.summary: Watcher not removed when user is deleted from LDAP

  {panel}

h3. *Feature Summary*

When a user has an existing JIRA database that is on a secure site(SSL), there is no way to configure JIRA configurator tool to this database as the tool does not have any means of specify what protocol (HTTP vs HTTPS) to use.

h3. *Expected Behavior*

User can specify that the database hostname is on a secure site. So as to allow the configurator tool connect correctly to the database.

h3. *Actual Behavior*

There is currently no way to specify this in the existing configurator tool

h3. *Workaround*

User would need to manually modify their dbconfig file found in JIRA home, specifying the database URL in here.
fields.summary: Add a Feature to allow JIRA configurator tool connect to databases with SSL = true

fields.description:
There are a few changes required to fix this:
- the AJS.undim override (in the issue-search-plugin) no longer matches the behaviour of the one from AUI. This means a bunch of attributes on elements are no cleaned up, and means they're no longer seen by screen readers (the whole page). The override needs to be removed.
- there are 2 other bits of code that can now be removed in JIRA because the fixes they were making are now in the AJS.undim method itself.
- calling AJS.dim twice has a bug when called twice (which the JIRA dialogs do) and is being fixed: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AUI-4223 - fix in the next 5.7.x version of AUI.
- JIRA dialogs do not specify aria-hidden="false"
fields.summary: Launching a dialog makes the page unusable in a screen reader

We believe there was a Google Chrome update.

fields.description:
Hello,
I have a custom field (text, single line).
I have an issue type whose creation and edit/view screens use the custom field.
When I create a issue of that type and assign the value -1 to the custom field, this value is not saved (it is saved as empty). I have tried with any other string and it is saved correctly. 
This happens whenever I create an issue both through the UI and through the JSON REST API. And also when I edit the issue and assign the value -1 to the field.
fields.summary: Field not saved when value is -1

fields.description:
Going through our documentation, I have noticed that all AdminJIRAServer071 documentation still shows the DBCP information, while 7.1 uses DBCP 2.

This causes confusion because default out of the dbconfig.xml differs, and screenshots of for example the JIRA Configuration Tool do not match what customers are seeing.

Example pages:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/connecting-jira-applications-to-oracle-802592181.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Using+the+JIRA+application+configuration+tool
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Tuning+database+connections

I would suggest doing a pass on all Database configuration pages to ensure that the information within is up to date.
fields.summary: DBCP 2 was introduced with JIRA 7.1, documentation still shows DBCP.

h3. Summary
REST API (rest/api/2/mypreferences) doesn't work correctly on JIRA 7.1.6.
It worked on JIRA 7.1.4 as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use a REST API ({{rest/api/2/mypreferences}}) as follows
#* GET request to {{<BASE_URL>/rest/api/2/mypreferences?key=jira.user.locale}}
# Check the response

h3. Expected Results
The response should contain information about a current locale setting of the user as JIRA 7.1.4 was (e.g. "en_US")

h3. Actual Results
404 error happened with the message "key not found: 'jira.user.locale'".
 
h3. Notes
* If any update on the API spec side and it is not a bug, could you please also update [the API doc|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/mypreferences]?
* When being fixed this bug, please make sure if PUT and DELETE method also works as expected?
fields.summary: REST API (rest/api/2/mypreferences) doesn't work correctly

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60971].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When a filter in JIRA is created, the column order is supposed to be configurable by the creator of the filter. Per the documentation, if the column order of the filter is changed when the filter is selected from 'Manage Filters', the change in column selection and order should be consistent for all users. This is currently not the case. The only way to preserve column configuration is to create a filter, change the column configuration, Save As, and create a second filter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a basic issue search
# Re-order the columns to the desired configuration
# Save the filter as a new filter called "Filter 1".
# Share that filter with everyone, then revisit the filter with your user. You will see that the column order persists.
# Log in as another user and view that filter. The column layout is system default and not the expected configuration.
# As the filter creator, Save As without making any changes, and create "Filter 2".
# Logging in as another user, you will see that the column order is now as it was configured by the creator of the filter.

h3. Expected Results
The column order and configuration of the filter should persist for all users and look as it did for the creator when initially saved.

h3. Actual Results
The creator has to save an additional filter for the column order and configuration to actually change for all users.
fields.summary: Filter Column Order is not initially saved
As an Admin, I want to be notified when an outage happens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60969].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The autocomplete/suggest logic used when searching for users (@mention autocompletes, user pickers, etc..) only works when the exact string searched is part of the result.

For example:
Target user to be searched for is named "Testing Username".

Searching for a phrase like "Test User" wouldn't work, because this exact phrase is not contained within the target string "Testing Username".


h3. Suggested Solution

Users would like to expand the search functionality to utilize +*spaces*+ as a separator for the search string, and search multiple values/tokens against the target name.

For example:
Target user to be searched for is named "Testing Username".

Searching for "Test User" results in two phrases to search for, "Test", and "User", both of which would result in match if used in current logic.
fields.summary: Allow for partial username searches separated by spaces

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After editing the name of an Issue Security Level, it's not updated immediately on the Create/Edit Issue screen.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create an Issue Security Scheme, add an issue security level.
# Assign the Issue Security Scheme to a project.
# Create an issue and apply an issue security level.
# Go to the Issue Security page to edit the name of the issue security level.
# View the issue with the renamed issue security level, note that on the View Issue screen, the security level is updated with the new name.
# Click to Edit the issue, or create a new issue.

h3. Expected Result
On Create Issue and Edit Issue screen, the renamed Issue Security level will be shown with the updated name.

h3. Actual Result
On Create Issue and Edit Issue screen, the renamed Issue Security level is not updated.

h3. Workaround
Revisit after 10 to 20 minutes, or restart the application to clear the caches.
fields.summary: Options of Issue Security Level is not updated immediately on Create/Edit Issue screen

fields.description:
Current behavior:
* After switching to 24-hour format (like most EU countries use) you cannot log time on the past days. 
* When selecting another day, _you must specify a date on which the work occurred_ error occurs.
* Worth to mention that the system is reading the date in the wrong order. Therefore, when opening the calendar to pick up the date today (11 may 2016) is converted to 16 may 2011

Steps to reproduce it:
* Switch JIRA to 24h format (I started with this [guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-jira-change-the-time-format-to-24-hours-734234435.html])
* Go to a JIRA issue and when logging time use the calendar to pick a day from the past, like "yesterday" or any other past day

Desired behavior:
Logging time in 24-hour format should wortk just as it does for the 12h AM/PM format
fields.summary: 24-hour time format doesn't allow time logging on past days

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60957].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Due to the way third-party JQL plugins can be written, {{SearchRequest.getQueryContext}} can result in executing JQL queries. This can lead to client-side timeouts, such as the JIRA Software Manage Boards page timing out, as context lookups on JQL queries result in the JQL query being executed.

h3. Suggested Solution

Modify the code as such that it does not execute third-party queries, causing timeouts and performance problems in JIRA.
 
h3. Workaround 

Disable the affected third-party plugin or work with the plugin developers to modify the way it's designed.
fields.summary: As a user of JIRA I do not want JQL context lookups to execute third-party JQL queries, timing out web requests

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60953].
  {panel}

h3. *Current situation*
Using labels in Confluence is genius. Confluence converts all upper-case letters to lower-case letters. In JIRA, one can add labels as he or she wants to.
The result is, that there is a confusion about what the correct label looks like.
E.g.: "Maintenance-Issue" or "maintenance-issue".

h3. *Suggestion*
Adding labels, having at least the same behavior for JIRA as for Confluence (and all other Atlassian products) would be great. As I think the way Confluence is handling labels is the best, I suggest to implement the Confluence approach for all Atlassian products.

{panel:title=Even better...}
In JIRA, one is able to provide a regular expression for checking project keys. This would also be great for verifying labels.
I always recommend my clients to use lower case letters only. Furthermore, I recommend to use no special characters like underscores or german umlauts expect hyphens.
Example: "hello_world" vs. "hello-world", "option_number-one" vs. "option-number-one"
By using hyphens only, it is ensured that your labels are homogeneous and the hyphen is easy to type on a keyboard because you don't need a key combination.
Using a regular expression like [a-z][\-a-z]*[a-z] ensures the correct usage of labels. :)
{panel}
fields.summary: Confluence-like labelling in JIRA

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60945].
  {panel}

h3. *Issue Summary*

When a user performs a search and the result includes a lot of issue types, the user is presented with the icons for these issue types instead of the name of the issue type.

In essence, making it difficult to easily discern which issue type each issue is if they have used same images as icons.

h3. *Feature*

Can an option be added that lets the JIRA admin toggle between showing the issue type name or it's icon for their instance.

h3. *Existing Behavior*

JIRA would only show the feature name if no icon is associated with it and there's no way to toggle between the two.

h3. *Known KB that Achieves feature partly*:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Display+the+Issue+Type+Name+in+Issue+Navigator+Column+Beside+the+Image+Icon?focusedCommentId=777017168#comment-777017168
fields.summary: Show Issue Type Name instead of Icon in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The permission to transition issues is set to be for the Current Assignee but when attepting to reassign the issue to another assignee through the transition screen, the transition fails because it claims that "User 'xxx' doesn't have the 'Transition Issues' permission" despite still being the current assignee and the issue is not reassgined.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* JIRA 6.4.11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start up a JIRA 6.4.11 instance
# Create a test project
# Modify the project's permission scheme so that the "Transition Issue" permission only applies for the Current Assignee.
# Modify the project's workflow of the project so that the transitions in the workflow has the validator set to be "Only users with Transition Issues permission can execute this transition.".
# Create a screeen that has the "Assignee" field.
# Associate the screen in the previous step to the transitions in the workflow.

h3. Expected Results
The transition succeeds and the assignee will be changed to a different user.

h3. Actual Results
The transition fails with the message "User 'xxx' doesn't have the 'Transition Issues' permission" despite still being the current assignee for the issue.
 
h3. Notes
# The JIRA permission helper claims that the user has the permission to transition the issue.
# The Transition will succeed if you do not try to assign to a different user.
fields.summary: "Current Assignee" Validator fails if user assigns issue to another user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60939].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
Java 8 update 20 has introduced an additional flag for the G1 garbage collector that enables string deduplication to lower the memory footprint of the JVM. The functionality can be enabled by adding the {{-XX:+UseStringDeduplication}} JVM flag.

More information about this parameter can be found in the following links:
- [https://blogs.oracle.com/java-platform-group/entry/g1_from_garbage_collector_to]
- [http://java-performance.info/java-string-deduplication/]
- [https://blog.codecentric.de/en/2014/08/string-deduplication-new-feature-java-8-update-20-2/]

h4. Suggestion
Evaluate adding this parameter by default, as it is said not to cause significant performance overhead, however it can save additional heap memory, asynchronously to GC cycles.
fields.summary: Enable string deduplication by default

Currently JIRA only alows floating poing input for custom field type _number field_. When user enter phone number for example: 01696462562 using number field it is being displayed as 169,646,256,6 which is not correct if you are entering mobile number.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users can not transition issues when JIRA is configured with a Microsoft SQL Server Database. When a transition involves accessing Issue component information this leads to a deadlock. The UI will eventually report the following error: 

{quote}
The call to the JIRA server did not complete within the timeout period. We are unsure of the result of this operation"
{quote}

This unexpected behaviour is caused by the usage of the deprecated method {{DbConnectionManager#execute}} in {{DefaultProjectComponentManager#findComponentsByIssue}}*. This results in JIRA borrowing a new connection from a pool and using this to access the database, which leads to a SQL Server deadlock at the time the workflow transition applied.

This is because the Workflow transition: {{OSWorkflowManager#doWorkflowAction}} opens a new transaction and another query is contending for the same relation. 

When collecting a thread dump, the following will be seen in the HTTP thread that makes the transition call:

h3. Environment
Jira 7.1.x running on: MS SQL

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an issue
# Close the issue (resolve the issue)
# Create a webhook (add a webhook that will trigger on a reopened issue)
# Try to reopen issue (transition the issue to an open state)

h3. Expected Results
When a JIRA issue is transitioned through workflows, the instance should not generate a deadlock on the server. 

h3. Actual Results
No response comes back from the MS SQL Server and as a result, the instance becomes unstable. Additionally, datasource connection pool may become exhausted. 

h3. Notes
To investigate this issue: use this query to see which session is locked and by whom:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
select cmd,* from sys.sysprocesses
where blocked > 0;
{code}

Use this query to see last executed SQL query :
{code:borderStyle=solid}
DBCC INPUTBUFFER(session_id);
{code}

Use this query to see open transactions in sessions:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
select * from sys.dm_tran_session_transactions;
{code}

h3. Workaround
Set {{READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT ON}} in your Microsoft SQL Server database this allows row versions to be stored in a temporary database that circumvents the need for locking on transactions. See also: [Deadlocks during SQL operations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/deadlocks-during-operation-with-ms-sql-264045011.html] for more information.
fields.summary: JIRA hangs due to deadlock in MSSQL on some workflow transitions

fields.description:
h5. Problem Encountered. 

When attempting to add a new dashboard gadget an SSLPeerUnverifiedException error is encountered. 

{noformat}
/rest/config/1.0/directory [c.a.g.r.internal.http.HttpClientFetcher] Unable to retrieve response
javax.net.ssl.SSLPeerUnverifiedException: Host name 'subdomain.s3.amazonaws.com' does not match the certificate subject provided by the peer (CN=*.s3.amazonaws.com, O=Amazon.com Inc., L=Seattle, ST=Washington, C=US)

/rest/config/1.0/directory [c.a.g.d.internal.rest.DirectoryResource] DirectoryResource: POST rejected: could not parse gadget at https://subdomain.s3.amazonaws.com/devices/jira_gadget.xml
com.atlassian.gadgets.GadgetParsingException: com.atlassian.gadgets.GadgetParsingException: org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException: Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 500
{noformat}

h5. Steps to reproduce

Attempt to add JIRA gadget using URL that is hosted in amazonaws and secured by amazonaws.com SSL.

h5. Additional details

This problem appears to be caused by https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCLIENT-1613
* This bug impacts apache.httpclient.version 4.4
* JIRA 6.4.13 shows apache.httpclient.version 4.3.6 in pom.xml
* JIRA 7.0.0 shows apache.httpclient.version 4.4.1 in pom.xml

For the example above, "*.s3.amazonaws.com" encounters this error because s3.amazonaws.com is listed in [public_suffix_list.dat | https://publicsuffix.org/list/effective_tld_names.dat]
* If the domain you are having problems with is not listed then the problem you are having may not be related. In this case you should generate a new certificate as this has resolved this error for other customers. 
* Note that this copy of public_suffix_list.dat may more recent that what is used by your JIRA Application version
fields.summary: SSLPeerUnverifiedException when trying to add new gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60926].
  {panel}

*Suggestion Request*

As a JIRA user, it would be convenient to modify attachments added to issues directly from inside the JIRA UI rather than having to download the file, edit the file and re-upload.

Such a feature would save us time and would reduce cases of having duplicate named attachments.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a JIRA issue.
# Add attachments to the issue.
# Open the issue and attempt to edit the attachment.

*Expected Result*
User can expand the attachment section and modify it from directly within JIRA

*Actual Result*
The attachment is downloaded and user has to perform the change off JIRA and when the changes have been made, re-upload the attachment back to the JIRA issue.
fields.summary: Ability to Modify attachment within JIRA

  {panel}

h3. Summary

The Project Settings link does not appear in the main project view for Project Administrators (users with the Administrators role)

h3. Environment
Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project or edit an existing one
# Add a user that is not a Global Administrator (administrator, site-admin) to the Administrators role or to a group that is part of the Administrators role
# Goto the project in JIRA

h3. Expected Results

The Project Settings link should be visible

!correctmenu.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

The Project Settings link is not seen

!mainmenu.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes

The only account's that can see the link are users that belong to a [Global Administrator | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Managing+global+permissions] Group


h3.Workaround

- Users can still click on the Gear icon in the upper right hand corner and select Projects for a list of projects they have administrative rights to
- Users can type GG and then type Projects for the projects page

!sidemenu.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Project Settings link missing from main project view

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, only linked issues from the same JIRA instance will be able to export out into XML, Excel and etc.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be useful if users can export linked issues from different JIRA instance that they have connected to the JIRA instance via Application Link.

h3. Workaround
This can be done via REST API; please refer to [JIRA REST API for Remote Issue Links|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+REST+API+for+Remote+Issue+Links] for more information.
fields.summary: Ability to export issues with linked issues from external JIRA instance

h3. Problem Definition

In Issue detail view, when pressing command button the top (blue) navigation bar disappears when we are surfing on not maximized browser window.

h3. Steps To Reproduce

# Restore down the browser window (Exit maximized browser window) 
# From Issues drop down menu select Search for Issues
# Select any ticket
# Click Comment button on the ticket or scroll down to leave a comment on the ticket.

h3. Expected behavior 

After clicking comment button the top navigation bar should stay there.

h3. Actual Behavior 

After clicking the comment button the top navigation bar disappears.

Note: This issue is not reproducible when the window is maximized
fields.summary: Top Navigation Bar Disappears When Pressing Comment Button In Small Browser Size

h3. Expected Results

Avatars should be changed after updated.

Avatars did not update on some pages.
h3. Note
 * This issue also happens on *Create Issue* screen and *Edit Issue* screen.
 * *View Issue* screen and *Issue Navigator* are showing the correct avatar.
 * Re-indexing does not fix the issue

Restart JIRA for the icons to be updated

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a customer has a large number of screens created in the Screens page https://<sitename>/secure/admin/ViewFieldScreens.jspa the page doesn't load, it times out showing a message of Page unavailable. The results are the same should you access it through the navigation menu or just pasting the link in the browser.

h3. Suggested Solution
If we could add pagination, we could limit the number of screens to be displayed so it wouldn't time out.  

h3. Workaround 
There's no workaround at the moment

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60892].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when editing permission schemes you can select grant permission but have to type in the starting letters for each permission to grant/delete them. 

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great to have a checkbox list for both groups/users/roles and on the other side granted permissions and run down the checkbox list. Also having a select option for the permission end of things would be great. The current method is clunky.
fields.summary: Checkbox option when editing permission schemes
